Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, cooking oil, dried thyme, black pepper, salt, garlic cloves, salsa, lime wedgepreparation:Place chicken breast halves in a resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. For marinade, stir together lime peel, lime juice, cooking oil, dried thyme, black pepper, salt, garlic cloves, salsa, lime wedgepreparation:Place chicken breast halves in a

Place fish fillets in bottom of greased baking dish in one layer. Mix soup with sherry, salt, pepper, and basil. Spread this over fish. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over top. Bake at 350 f for 20-30 minutes until fish flakes. Garnish with lemon wedges and parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly.

Heat olive oil in a small pan and fry chili for 3-4 minutes over a low heat. Stir in chopped red pepper. Drain sweet potato and garlic and mash with 2 tbsp cream cheese and milk, adding more if needed. Stir red pepper, chili and coriander into mash. Add salt and black pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with olive oil. In a small bowl, mix the spices and rub over both sides of chicken. Place in the prepared pan. Pour broth over chicken. Bake for 20 minute. In a small bowl, mix preserves and mustard, brush or spoon over chicken and bake an additional 10-15 minute or until done.

Mix honey, wine, cinnamon and mustard in small saucepan. Add honey, wine, cinnamon and mustard. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens and boils. Boil and stir for one minute. Remove ham about 20 minutes before done, pour drippings from pan. Cut fat surface of ham in diamond shapes. Pour glaze over or pat on with brush. Bake 20 more minutes at 325.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Remove all visible fat from pork. Place in a shallow baking pan. In a small bowl, whisk together remaining ingredients except sesame seeds and onions. Brush honey mixture over pork. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes. To serve, slice thinly and garnish with green onions.

In a large bowl, combine condensed milk, egg whites, granulated sugar, peppermint extract, green food coloring, mini chocolate chips. Blend well. Gradually fold in whipped cream. Add chocolate chips and mix well. Pour into a 9x5-inch freezer container. Cover and freeze at least 6 hours.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll rolls into 4 rectangles and place in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Press up sides slightly and press perforations together. Layer cooked sausage, cooked bacon, hash browns, and cheese. At this point you can make it ahead and refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Mix together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour mixture over the dish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

Preheat oven to 350f. Season chicken breasts with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Wrap each chicken breast in 1 strip of bacon and place in a 9x13x2-inch baking dish. In a small bowl, mix the sour cream and soup. Spoon mixture over the chicken and bake uncovered for 40 to 50 minutes or until slightly brown on top. Serve with hot cooked rice, if desired.

Leave the refrigerator burgers in the container on the counter for about 10 minutes, it is easier to spread the refrigerator rolls out when they are at room temperature. Open the containers and squish the rolls out onto a greased pizza pan, slightly over lapping the rolls. Bake in the oven for 7-10 minutes at 375 only until the dough puffs and starts to get stiff to the touch, just before it starts to brown. Remove dough from the oven. Mix the tomato sauce and oregano together. Spread tomato sauce mix onto the dough. Spread the shredded mozzerella cheese over the hamburger. Sprinkle pineapple over the cheese. Bake the pizza another 10 minutes at 375 or until the cheese is melted and the dough just starts to turn brown.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cream, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper. In a separate bowl, whisk together the cream, mayonnaise, cheddar cheese

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove stones and place cut nectarines on the parchment paper in an oven proof dish or pan facing up. Drizzle honey, vanilla and sprinkle brown sugar over the top. Bake for 15 minutess, scoop up the juices from the bottom of the pan and coat nectarines and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until golden and sticky. Serve with yoghurt, drizzled with honey.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook turkey for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and turkey is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Place chicken and sauce over lettuce and top with blue cheese. Roll up and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Using a baking sheet with a lip, melt butter. Mix seasoning into the butter, and then toss in almonds. Bake seasoned nuts for about 10-12 minutes, stirring once, until toasted and fragrant. Remove from heat and serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine all ingredients in a jar with a lid. Cover and shake to mix thoroughly. Let stand at least 2 hours to blend seasonings. Shake well before using. Wonderful on italian cabbage and onion salad dressing.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray and cook chicken for 6 minutes. Drain. Add hot sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 3-5 minutes or until sauce is thickened and chicken is no longer pink in center. Place lettuce on warm tortillas and drizzle dressing on top. Roll up and serve.

Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in frying pan over medium heat. Add egg and fry until cooked to your preference. In a nonstick pan, fry ham until warm and lightly brown. Remove from pan and keep warm. On one slice of sourdough bread, layer slice of cheddar cheese, ham, slice of swiss cheese and fried egg. Top with other slice of bread. Brush melted butter on sandwich and place buttered side down in skillet used to fry ham. Brush melted butter on top. After a few minutes, flip sandwich over and fry until golden brown and cheese is melted.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter and saute until butter is melted. Add parmesan cheese and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add milk and saute until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and saute until
Preheat oven to 350f. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack and keep in an airtight container once cold.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Meanwhile, combine cornstarch and water in a small bowl. In saucepan, melt chocolate and condensed milk over low heat, stirring occasionally. Add cornstarch mixture, then the eggs, butter, and salt. Stir until well-combined and smooth. Remove from the heat and add pecans. Mix well and pour into crust. Bake for approximately 30-35 minutes, until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean. Cool on a rack, then cover and refrigerate for a minimum of 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f & grease a glass baking dish. Cook flat noodles in boiling water for 7 minutes, then drain & spoon noodles into prepared baking dish. Wisk together milk, sugar, cream cheese, eggs, nectar & melted butter, beating for 2 minutes. Stir in quartered apricots, then add mixture to noodles in baking dish. Bake about 60 minutes, until kugel is set & top is golden brown. Serve warm or cold.
Combine everything in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Simmer 5 minutes. Place 3 pork chops in a pan. Spoon sauce on top and cover. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Unroll crescent dough and place in a circle on round stone, with the wide ends in the middle and the pointed ends to the outside. You should have an circle in the middle of the stone. You will need to overlap the wide ends a bit to make a circle. Mix the remaining ingredients in a bowl, using more mayo if mixture appears to be dry. Place the mixture in a circle on the crescent rolls on the wide ends. Fold the pointed ends over the mixture to the middle of the stone. Tuck the ends under. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the crescent rolls are golden brown. Slice and serve.

In a medium bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Push mixture together in the center of the bowl, making a ball shape, cover bowl, and refrigerate 2 hours or longer. Place a large strip of plastic wrap on the counter top. Sprinkle remaining cup of cheese over the center of the shredded cheese, and use plastic wrap to mold into a ball. Roll the ball to completely cover in shredded cheese. Wrap the formed cheese ball in plastic wrap and refrigerate one hour or longer. Sprinkle remaining cup of cheese over the center of

Spray a slow cooker container with butter-flavored cooking spray. Combine apples and raisins in crock. Add splenda, apple pie spice, and apple juice. Mix well to combine. Dot top with margarine. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours.

Place the tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Blend either coarse or smooth, depending on your preference. Transfer tomatillo salsa to covered container and refrigerate at least 3 hours. Good with tortilla chips, enchiladas, tacos, etc. I always triple the recipe and freeze in 8 ounce containers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease two 9x5-inch loaf pans. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Beat for an additional 2 minutes. Pour into pans and bake for an hour or till a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the bottom crust in your pie plate. Cook the spinach, drain it, and chop it finely. Saute the chopped onion in a little cooking spray. Mix together the spinach, the onion, and the rest of the ingredients. Pour the mixture into the pie crust. Add the top crust and seal. Bake for 30-40 minutes.

Preheat broiler to high. Arrange the baby peppers in a single layer on a foil-lined jelly roll pan, and broil peppers for 4 minutes on each side or until blackened and tender. Cool, combine peppers, olive oil, garlic cloves, lemon rind, red pepper, salt, and mozzarella balls, and toss. Cover, and refrigerate overnight, tossing after 6 hours. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Stir in basil leaves, and lemon juice before serving. Serve with a slotted spoon.

In a dutch oven, bring 4 cups water to a boil. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Remove from the heat. Add tea bags. Steep for 5-8 minutes. Discard tea bags. Stir in juice concentrates and remaining water. Serve over ice.

Heat oil in skillet, add onion, pepper, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic and tomato paste. Cook for 10 minutes. Bring sauce to a boil, then add shrimp and lemon juice. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 2 minutes. Add coconut milk and stir-fry 3-4 minutes until shrimp are pink and opaque. Add cilantro. Toss well and transfer to serving plates. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon toasted coconut and 1 tablespoon chopped peanuts. Garnish with lime wedges.

In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugar, cream, baking soda, butter, vanilla, nuts in a large saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 7 minutes or until softball stage. Remove pan from heat and stir in white chocolate until melted. Add marshmallow cream and walnuts. Beat by hand until completely blended. Spread into a greased 9x9 inch baking pan. Cool at room temperature.

Heat oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large cookie sheet. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with mixer at high speed, until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, cocoa, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix until uniform. Mix in chopped cherries. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake about 10-12 minutes or until set.

Preheat oven to 250f. In a large bowl combine the cereal, oyster crackers, pretzels, pistachios and cheese. In a small bowl combine the butter, salad dressing mix, and garlic powder. Drizzle over the cereal mix, tossing to lightly coat mixture. Place on a cookie or baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven, stir in dry fruit, and spread mixture on buttered foil to cool. Break into bite size pieces and store in airtight container.

Heat olive oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until carrots are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Chop onions and slice mushrooms. Melt margarine in skillet. Saute onions until transparent. Add mushrooms. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Allow to cool. Mix together egg, flour, non-dairy milk and wine. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour into pie crust. Form lattice strips from second crust and place on top of quiche. Bake for 2 minutes.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, heat oil in a large saute or fry pan until very hot. Add vegetables all at once, spreading in an even layer. Do not stir until bottom of layer begins to brown. Flip and stir to get unbrowned pieces to bottom. Let cook until beginning to brown. The trick here is to keep heat high and brown pieces without overcooking or burning them. If pieces are browned, but not soft enough for your taste, turn off heat and cover pan for a few minutes.

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add beef and brown. Sprinkle with flour and cook an additional minute. Add water, wine, soup mix and bouillon and stir. Transfer to casserole dish with lid and bake at 325f for 3 hours. Ensure it does not go dry by adding wine or water. Fry mushrooms in pan with 1 tbsp olive oil. Add mushrooms to mixture and return to oven for an hour. Cook noodles as directed. Remove mixture from oven and stir in sour cream. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut apple cinnamon rolls in half crosswise to create 2 short round rolls. Press each half roll into one muffin cup, forming it into a cup shape. Mix together cinnamon roll dough, fresh blueberries, blueberry preserves, lemon peel, pecans, milk, and salt. Bake 12 minutes at 350 degrees until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes in the muffin tin, then remove and place on wire rack. Drizzle icing over rolls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin pan with cooking spray. Beat sugar and eggs together until thickened. Add enough water to cover, and bring to a boil over high heat. Immediately reduce heat, and simmer for about 1 hour, or until the sauce has thickened. Taste for sweetness, and adjust with additional sugar if necessary. You can not overcook, so continue cooking until you have a good thick consistency. Let mixture cool, then refrigerate in a covered container.

Heat oven to 350f. Line an 8-inch pie pan or heatproof baking dish with the pie dough. Prick the dough with the tines of a fork. In a second bowl, mix together the apples, cup of the sugar, and the unsalted butter. Work these ingredients together with a fork until you have a crumbly mixture. Fill the pie crust with the apple mixture and smooth over the surface. Spoon the crumble over the apple mixture so that the apples are completely covered. Bake for 25 minutes.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add butter. While whisking, slowly add in flour. When blended, add salt, pepper, nutmeg and cayenne. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, whisking constantly. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Mix in the parmesan cheese. Season with salt and lots of black pepper.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add anchovies, black olives, capers, cauliflower, red bell pepper, garlic cloves, herbs, olive oil, red wine vinegar. Add anchovies, black olives, capers, cauliflower, red bell

Place peach lavender jam in a non-reactive saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring. Boil hard for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Take off the heat, stir in the pectin and ladle into hot sterilized jars. Seal and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Place hot jars on a towel on your counter and let cool overnight. Check seals.

Combine all the ingredients in a sauce pan, bring to a boil and simmer 10 minutes, cool a bit. Place the slabs of ribs in a large plastic bag and pour in the sauce, turn to coat the ribs and seal the bag. Marinate in the fridge for at least an hour. Remove ribs from the marinade and reserve the marinade. Place ribs over medium heat and grill for 50-60 minutes turning the ribs and basting with the marinade during the last 20 minutes of cooking.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Heat over medium-high heat until melted. Add 2 cups of half and half, salt, and pepper, stirring for 5 minutes, but do not let it boil. Slowly add parmesan and pesto. Heat through and serve over fettuccine.

In a large bowl, combine the warm water, buttermilk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking soda, salt. Cover and process on low speed for 30 seconds or until blended. In a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. Add the yeast mixture and stir with a spoon until blended. Cover and let rise ntil doubled, about 30 minutes. Bake at 350 for 18-20 minutes or until golden.

In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first six ingredients. Add flank steak. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Coat grill rack with nonstick cooking spray before starting the grill. Drain and discard marinade. Grill beef, covered, over medium-hot coals for 6-8 minutes on each side or until meat reaches desired doneness.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add in onion and saute until golden. Add in sliced cabbage, cider vinegar, sugar, celery seeds and black pepper. Mix to combine and cook until the cabbage if crisp-tender and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Season with salt.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Saut crushed garlic for 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomato sauce. Add salt, pepper, and pesto. Add cream cheese and stir well until fully melted. Stir parmesan cheese until melted. Add cream and stir well.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine oil, garlic, herbs, mustard and juice in a bowl. Add potatoes and toss until potatoes are well coated with mixture. Return potatoes to oven trays and drizzle with melted butter. Cook under hot grill until golden brown, turning potatoes when necessary. Serve sprinkled with salt if desired.

Mix sugar, cream cheese and vanilla with mixer until smooth. Spread into a deep pie dish. Spread caramel topping on top, then sprinkle with toffee bits and nuts. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, core and cut apples into wedges and arrange around the edge of the pie dish, alternating red and green slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. In a bowl gently mix all your ingredients until well combined. Transfer meat mixture in loaf pan and gently press down. Bake until internal temperature reaches 180 degrees, about 1 hour and 15 minutes. As an option you can brush the top of the meatloaf with a little extra wing sauce when you pull it out of the oven to give it a better appearance.

In a blender, puree 2 cans of black beans and set aside. Under medium heat, saut onion and garlic for about five minutes in a medium size pot. Add salt, pepper& splash of dry sherry. Add puree black beans, 2 cans of whole beans, cumin, chili powder, bay leaves, cilantro and more salt and pepper if needed. Lower heat and let simmer for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and stir until just combined.

In a large nonstick saut pan over medium heat, combine cooked rice and whole milk. Heat until mixture begins to boil. Decrease heat to low and cook to a simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture begins to thicken, approximately 5 minutes. Increase heat to medium, add heavy cream, coconut milk, sugar, and cardamom. Continue to cook until mixture just begins to thicken again, approximately 5-10 minutes. Use a whisk to prevent the cardamom from clumping. Once mixture begins to thicken, remove from heat and stir in raisins and pistachios. Transfer the mixture to individual serving dishes or a glass bowl and place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding. Serve chilled or at room temperature. I like my rice pudding a little sweet, so i also added a little bit more sugar than the 2 oz. Called for in the recipe to suit my personal taste.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. In a small bowl, combine paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, black pepper and salt. Divide in half. In a medium bowl, combine half of spice mixture, sweet potatoes, olive oil and maple syrup. Toss to coat sweet potatoes thoroughly. Spread sweet potatoes onto foil-lined baking sheet into a single layer, leaving two spaces in the middle for the pork chops. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until pork chops are done.

In a small saucepan over moderately low heat, melt 1 stick of the butter. Continue heating, swirling the pan to prevent burning, until the butter turns nut brown. Transfer the butter to a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer on low speed, gradually blend in the powdered sugar and salt alternately with the milk and vanilla, until the frosting is smooth. Beat in the remaining butter, bit by bit. Refrigerate until mixture is cool and thick enough to spread. Keep frosted cake or cupcakes refridgerated, since the frosting has a tendency to soften and drip off the sides if it gets too warm.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl, beat butter, brown sugar and margarine until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and eggs. Blend well. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 8 to 10 minutes or until light golden brown.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Place chicken in baking dish. Combine mustard, honey, butter, dijon mustard, curry powder, red cayenne pepper and cayenne. Mix well to combine. Pour over the chicken pieces in the baking dish. Mix the chicken pieces slightly with your hands to coat. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Turn the chicken pieces over. With a spoon, baste with sauce. Bake for another 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked.

Preheat an 8-inch pot with a tight fitting cover over moderate heat. Add oil, onion and garlic and saute for 2 or 3 minutes. Add broth to the pan and bring to a boil. Stir in orzo and return to boiling. Cover pot and reduce heat to simmer. Cook 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until liquid is absorbed and orzo is tender. Remove lid and stir in cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Heat oven to 350f. Cook beef, stirring occasionally until brown. Drain off fat. Stir in rice, soup, chilies, and taco seasoning mix. Spoon into 12 x 8-inch baking pan. Top with tomatoes cheese and corn chips. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until heated through.

Cream the butter and peanut butter together until fully incorporated. Add the sugar and cream on medium speed. Add the flour and baking soda, mix until no white remains, then add the chocolate and mix on low just until everything comes together. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto parchment-lined baking sheets. Bake at 350 for 9 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onions and garlic and cook until softened and starting to brown, about 10 minutes. In food processor combine sour cream, cream cheese, onion mixture, parsley, salt and pepper. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Serve with chips, pita or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 9 x 9-inch square pan. Mix milk, lemon peel and lemon juice until thickened. Reserve. Mix remaining ingredients until crumbly. Press half of the crumbly mixture in pan. Bake about 10 minutes or until edge is golden brown and center is set but soft. Cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook noodles in boiling water until al dente. When bacon is cool, crumble it into small pieces. Add the sour cream and chopped onion to the cooked noodles. Add the bacon and half of the cheese into the noodles, stir well. Pour mixture into a square casserole dish and top with remaining cheddar cheese. Bake in oven for 15 minutes or until bubbly and cheese has melted.

In a large frying pan, fry bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and drain. Add cabbage, butter and water to bacon grease and cook until tender. Stop cooking when the cabbage is still a bit crunchy. Add salt and pepper to taste maybe a little more butter, not much. Slice sausage and lay on top of cabbage. Continue to cook a little longer to warm the sausage. Crumble bacon over all. Yummmy -- great with black eyed-peas and cornbread.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet. Add garlic and shrimp. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Saute 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Turn shrimp with spatula. Cook shrimp 2 minutes longer on other side. Remove shrimp to serving platter. Garnish with lemon wedges. We give this a little squirt with the lemon wedge.

In bottom of crockpot, place carrots, potatoes, onions and garlic. Trim fat from brisket and sprinkle with salt, black pepper and thyme. Place brisket on top of vegetables. Add beef broth, cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours. Before serving, remove 1 cup of broth from crockpot and pour into skillet. Add cabbage wedges and simmer until cabbage is tender. Cut meat across the grain and serve with vegetables and broth.

Heat grill to high. Melt butter in a frying pan and fry mushrooms until tender. Add garlic and thyme and cook for another minute. Toast the bread, top with the mushrooms and then the cheese. Grill until cheese is brown and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the first seven ingredients. Transfer to a baking dish. Mix cracker crumbs and parmesan cheese together, then add in the butter and butter. Mix to combine, then sprinkle over top. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes or until heated through.

Place the cake mix and pudding mix in a large bowl and stir well. Add the mandarin oranges in their liquid and the egg substitute. Beat for about 2 minutes or until the mixture is smooth and the oranges are pureed. Spray a 12-cup bundt pan well and spread batter evenly. Bake for 35-40 minutes, until the top springs back when touched and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow cake to cool in the pan for 45 minutes, then invert onto a platter. Sprinkle powdered sugar on top, if desired. Sprinkle powdered sugar

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Spread the flaked almonds over a small plate. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate, and top each with another slice. Dip sandwiches into egg mixture, then press into the almonds, to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and half of the butter in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Sprinkle 2 slices of bread with chocolate

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place chicken in glass baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and whisk together until well blended and smooth. Pour sauce mixture over chicken. Bake chicken with sauce mixture for about 20 - 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. For best results turn chicken over half way through cooking.

Preheat oven to 350f. Stir together brown sugar, cayenne, and black pepper in a small bowl. Arrange bacon slices in l layer on a large broiler pan and bake in middle of oven for 20 minutes. Turn slices over and sprinkle evenly with spiced sugar. Continue baking until bacon is crisp and brown, 15 to 20 minutes more, then transfer to paper towels to drain.
Heat oven to 400f degrees. Place bratwurst in a greased 9x13 dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes till flakes easy with fork. Pour over bratwurst. Bake at 400 for

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Place marinated pork in a roasting pan, and bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes, or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees f, basting meat often with marinade.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In small mixing bowl, combine cooking spray, seafood seasoning, baking potatoes, salmon filletspreparation:Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In small mixing bowl, combine

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. A half-hour before cooking, remove filet from refrigerator. Heat a large skillet over high heat. Pat filet dry and season generously with salt and pepper. Add oil to hot skillet and when it begins to smoke add steak. Reduce heat slightly and cook steak until browned, about 4 minutes on each side. Transfer skillet to the oven. Roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted sideways into the steak registers 120 degrees f for medium-rare, about 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer steak to a cutting board and let it rest for 10 minutes. Cut steak from the bone and carve meat across the grain.

Combine the cabbage, carrot, onion and celery ribs in a large mixing bowl. To prepare the dressing, in a small bowl combine the mayonnaise, lime juice, zest, cumin, chili powder, sugar, salt and pepper. Whisk to combine. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and stir to combine. Cover and allow the slaw to sit for at least 30 minutes, tossing every so often to combine well. Top with raisins before serving.

In a large saucepan, saute the onions and garlic in 3 tablespoons of oil for 5 minutes, until limp, then add the last tablespoon of oil and the potatoes and stir-fry for a minute. Add the stock, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes, until the potatoes are mushy. Remove from heat and puree. Return the soup to the pot, season with salt and cayenne, and stir in the chopped cilantro. You can serve the soup cold--or reheat by slowly bringing it to a simmer. Ladle into soup plates and top with a sprinkling of cilantro or chives.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add bacon, red potatoes, onion, green pepper, eggs, milk, salt, pepper, cheddar cheese. Cook and stir until eggs are completely set. Sprinkle with cheese and let stand until cheese has melted.

Heat large non-stick skillet, swirl in oil, then add garlic. Saute 30 seconds. Add beef in two batches, cook til just browned, about 2 minutes. Drain pasta, add to bowl with yogurt dressing. Add steak and tomatoes, toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a large cookie sheet. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl with mixer at high speed, until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Combine flour, cocoa, cream of tartar, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix until uniform. Mix in chopped cherries. Drop dough by tablespoonfuls onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake about 10-12 minutes or until set.

Cook pasta until al dente. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside. Reduce heat and stir in salt, pepper, cream, pesto, and parmesan cheese. Cook until chicken is no longer pink inside. Cook until chicken is no longer pink

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix together dry ingredients. Stir in beaten eggs, butter, & milk. Add enough additional butter or oil to cover the bottom of a 9 or 10 inch cast iron skillet and place pan in hot oven. When the pan is very hot, remove from the oven & pour the cornbread batter into the skillet. Return to oven & bake approximately 15 minutes until browned. Cut into wedges to serve.

Place apple, orange and all remaining ingredients into crock pot to full. Add brown sugar. Stick whole cloves into skin of orange and apple wedges. Place apple, orange and all remaining ingredients into cheese cloth, tie with string and drop into crock pot. Bring to a boil, about 2 to 2 hours on high. Once the cider is boiling, reduce setting to low. Keep on low for 2 hours or more before serving. Replenish with additional cider when needed. If cider is cold, return setting to high until heated. Serve or have guests serve themselves from the crock pot. If desired, leave a bottle of spiced rum nearby.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together all ingredients from ground beef through pizza sauce. Separate the halves of the hamburger buns, placing each half face-up on a baking sheet. Spread the meat mixture on each of the hamburger buns. Top each with a slice of mozzarella. Bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is golden and bubbly.

In a large skillet sprayed with butter-flavored cooking spray, brown meat and onion. Add mushroom soup, mushrooms, black pepper and noodles. Mix well to combine. Simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Sim

Put chocolate chips and butterscotch chips in the saucepan. Put the saucepan on the burner and turn on the stove to low. Stir and stir until the mixture is melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Turn off the burner and quickly add the chow mein noodles and the peanuts. Mix and stir until they are evenly coated. Cover the cookie sheets with wax paper. Drop the candy by teaspoonfuls onto the wax paper-covered cookie sheets. Put the cookie sheets into the refrigerator to cool the candies. When they are cool, take them off the waxed paper. Put them in plastic bags. Keep them in the refrigerator.

In a wok or large frying pan over medium high heat, saute the spinach and garlic in the oil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Transfer to a platter in the same pan, heat the wine and saute the celery or bok choy and mushrooms, stirring constantly, for 3 minutes. Add the rice, scallions and spinach. Heat through. Season with soy sauce or tamari.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments.

Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add green beans and saute till beans are just crisp but tender, about 5 minutes. In a small bowl stir together soy sauce, minced garlic, honey and ginger. Pour over green beans in skillet and boil until sauce thickens and coats vegetables, about 2 minutes. In a separate bowl combine butter, garlic and pepper. Drain beans. Place in serving bowl. Add butter mixture. Toss to coat evenly. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Stir together oil & garlic, then using a pastry brush, brush one side of each bread slice with the oil mixture. Place bread slices on a baking sheet & bake about 10 minutes or until tops of bread slices are golden brown. Meanwhile, in medium bowl, toss together eggs, apple, walnuts & salad dressing. Top each toasted bread slice with some of the peaches, roma tomatoes, garlic clove, red wine vinegar, fresh basil, salt & freshly ground black pepper, baguette. Serve immediately.

Place the steak on broiler pan and cook until tender. Sprinkle with flour. Stir until blended. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Add blue cheese, wine or chicken broth, white pepper and pepper sauce. Heat through. Serve sauce over meat.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix nuts, pineapple, and coconut in large bowl. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt and add to nut mixture. Mix well until mixture is completely coated with flour. Beat eggs until foamy and add vanilla to eggs. Pour egg mixture into dry mixture and stir until combined. Divide evenly between two 9 x 5 greased loaf pans and bake for 60-70 minutes or until centers test done. Remove from pans and cool completely on racks. Wrap in foil or plastic wrap and refrigerate.

Cook rice according to package directions. To prepare the beans, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onions and saute until tender. Sprinkle on chili powder and cook 1 minute, stirring frequently. Add beans, salsa, and water and cook about 5 minutes. Serve beans over rice, with sour cream on top.

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments. Serve immediately, or chill. Serve with raw veggies or tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut chicken in half. Arrange, skin side up, in a roasting pan. Combine butter, lemon juice, and spices in a small bowl and mix well. Brush chicken with mixture. Roast until juices run clear. Broil 6 inches from heat for 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine first seven ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in green chilies and red bell pepper. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until it is lightly browned and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 400. Brush a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with olive oil. Layer the sliced potatoes, mushrooms, and onions, in the dish. Sprinkle with the salt and sage leaves. Pour the cream over evenly. Bake, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or just until the pork chops are cooked through and the potatoes are tender.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine flour and sugar in a large bowl or food processor. Add margarine and process, or mix together with your fingers, until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add cold water, one tablespoon at a time, and process, or mix, until a manageable dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll into a 12-inch circle. Press dough into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie pan or removable-bottom tart pan. Prick the bottom all over with a fork, cover dough with foil and fill with dried beans or rice. Bake 10 minutes. Remove beans and foil and bake until dough rolls up into a ball. Pinch off pieces and roll into 1-inch balls. Roll out and add 2 tablespoons of your favorite filling. Fold dough over filling. Seal with water and fry in hot oil. Make sure dough is sealed or filling will ooze out during cooking.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Place tortillas on flat surface, spread 1 tablespoon of salsa on half of tortilla, place half of meatloaf over salsa, top with half of cheese. Fold other half of tortilla over cheese. Repeat with rest of the ingredients for other tortilla. Place both in skillet and lightly brown on both sides, about 10 minutes total, or until desired brownness is reached. Cut each in half. Eat and enjoy.
Preheat oven to 350f. Spray 13x9 pan with cooking spray. Drain butter beans and pour into pan. Add all other ingredients and mix well. Bake for 1 hour or until brown and bubbling.

In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first six ingredients. Pour 1 cup marinade into a large resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 5-7 hours. Cover and refrigerate remaining marinade. Drain and discard marinade. On six- 8 metal or soaked wooden skewers, alternately thread chicken and vegetables. Grill, covered, over medium heat for 5-7 minutes on each side or until chicken juices run clear, basting frequently with reserved marinade.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the eggs and sugar until very thick. The batter should fall from the beaters in a thick ribbon. Beat in the vanilla. While youre beating the eggs and sugar, heat the hot chocolate and butter in a small saucepan to just simmering. Add the hot chocolate mixture to the egg mixture in a slow, steady stream as you continue beating. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, stirring until theyre just combined. Pour the batter into a lightly greased 9 inch cake round. Bake for 50 minutes, or until the cake is a deep golden brown and starting to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove the cake

Place the potatoes in a bowl. Add seasonings and oil. Toss to coat well. Transfer to a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake in 400f oven, stirring 3 or 4 times, for 55 to 65 minutes or until golden and tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9 x 13 pan with non stick spray. Place flour in bowl and dredge chicken and shake off excess. Place in pan. Sprinkle dry soup mix over all. Empty canned soups into a 4 cup measuring bowl and mix well with enough milk to arrive at the 4 cup level. Pour mixture over the chicken. Bake uncovered 1 hour.

Heat oven to 425. Line baking sheet with foil. Place pork in pan. In small bowl, mix remaining ingredients. Brush over pork tenderloin. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until pork has slight blush of pink in center and meat thermometer inserted reads 160. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut diagonally into slices.

Preheat oven to 350f and spray a baking sheet with pam cooking spray. Put all the dry ingredients into a ziplock bag and shake to combine. Remove chicken from the ziplock bag and shake off any excess buttermilk and add to the breadcrumb mix, add 3 pieces at a time and shake to coat the chicken. Remove and place on baking sheet. Repeat till all pieces are coated. Spray chicken with pam cooking spray and bake for about 20 minutes.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Discard garlic. Add onion and cook until softened. Add tomatoes with juice, sausage and pepper flakes. Cook over medium high heat, until sauce is thickened. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and toss with sausage in large bowl. Toss with mozzarella. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and chopped parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 16 muffin cups. Cut each banana in half crosswise to create 2 short round rolls. Press each half roll into one muffin cup, forming it into a cup shape. Mix together ther blueberries, preserves and lemon peel, and spoon some of the mixture into each muffin cup. Sprinkle each cup with pecans. Bake 12 minutes at 375 degrees until golden brown. Cool for 10 minutes in the muffin tin, then remove and place on wire rack. Drizzle icing over rolls.

In a heavy-bottomed pot over medium, fry the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon and drain on paper towels. Saute the onion and garlic in the bacon grease over low heat until soft, about 3 minutes. Add the brussels sprouts and stir them around so that they are coated with the bacon grease. Add the broth and cook, covered, over low heat until the sprouts are easily pierced with a fork, about 12-15 minutes. Stir in the butter just before serving. Garnish each serving with bacon bits.

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray an 8-inch pie plate with vegetable cooking spray. In a large bowl combine egg with melted butter. Whisk until well combined. Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt in a small bowl. Combine with egg mixture. Pour in buttermilk and mix well. Beat the yolks until pale and smooth. Beat in the buttermilk and then the baking soda and mix well. Beat in the dry ingredients mixing as you add. Make sure the batter is smooth. Add in the melted butter and mix well. Make sure the griddle is really hot. Ladle batter onto griddle. Turn when bubbles form across the cakes and allow to lightly brown on the second side. Serve with warm maple syrup and sweet butter.

Place cucumbers in bowl. Add salt, toss and chill 1 hour. Drain cucumbers and return to bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in another bowl. Pour over cucumbers and toss to coat. Can be prepared 1 day ahead and refrigerated.

In large non-stick skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add in spinach and chopped garlic. Saute stirring for about 10-12 minutes or until all the liquid from the spinach evaporates. Add in the breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Mix to combine and heat through. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a mixing bowl, combine all dry ingredients, except pumpkin seeds, in a large mixing bowl and mix well. In a seperate bowl, slightly beat the eggs with a fork or wire whisk. Add thwe remaining wet ingredients to the eggs and stir well. Fold in chocolate chips. Coat 2 bread pans evenly with cooking spray. Pout half of the mixture into each pan. Bake for 50-60 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, beat the margarine, white and brown sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, beat well. In another bowl, sift flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to the creamed mixture, stirring well. Fold in butter brickle bits, and chocolate chips. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Can be frosted with chocolate frosting.

In a large tea pot, place tea bags, orange zest, mint leaves and cloves and then pour boiling water over all. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Cover and let steep until cool. Strain tea through mesh strainer into a large pitcher filled with ice. Stir in grapefruit juice. Serve over ice in large glasses, garnished with mint sprigs, if desired.

Heat oil on medium high heat in large skillet or frying pan. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Combine dry ingredients. Moisten chicken pieces with water. Dredge chicken in flour and crumb mixture. Quickly fry chicken on all sides until browned and crisp. Place in covered baking dish and bake additional 20-30 minutes to re-crisp chicken, serve.

In the bowl of an electric mixer combine the powdered sugar, milk, vanilla extract, food coloring with an electric mixer on medium-low speed until smooth and light. Beat in the sugar, a little at a time, until smooth and of desired spreading consistency. Gently fold in the oreos. Use frosting as desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Sautee onions in butter, margarine or oil over medium heat, until soft. Place chicken breasts in casserole dish and season with salt, pepper and garlic. Pour mushrooms and sauteed onions over chicken. Cover dish with bbq sauce. Cover dish with lid or aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour.

In a medium size glass bowl mix together the tomatoes, jalapeno pepper, cilantro, onion, garlic, sugar, and salt and pepper. Combine well. Add in the juice. Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours before serving. Serve with fresh tortilla chips.

In a food processer or blender, put in oil, soy sauce, onion, garlic, lime and lemon juices, cayenne, tandoori paste, and sugar and puree. In a gallon size zip top bag, put pieces of selected meat and pour in marinade. Seal bag, removing as much air as possible. Allow steak to marinate for at least 1 hour in refrigerator. Then grill or broil selected meat to doneness.

Wash and skin potatoes, chop into large chunks. Boil potatoes until tender and mash. Stir in butter, cinnamon, brown sugar and mini marshmallows to taste. Mix in a separate bowl, flour, sugar, cinnamon, and pecans, drizzle melted butter over mixture and stir to moisten, mixture should resemble chunky crumbs. Pour potatoes mixture into casserole dish and cover with a thin layer of mini-marshmallows. Top with pecan mixture. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until brown and bubbly.

Mix all ingredients together in blender. Pour into 6- 3oz molds or paper cups. Freeze for one hour, place sticks in the middle. Freeze for another 3 hours, until solid. To release pops, dip molds into hot water until pops loosen and slide out. If using paper cups, peel away paper.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large mixing bowl, cream your butter and sugars til fluffy and airy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture until combined well drop by quarter cup measure on to an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 12 to 13 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from baking sheet and then cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix until just moistened. Spoon into lined or nonstick, sprayed mini muffin pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove muffins from the tray and cool on a wire rack.

Heat oven to 400 f. Combine the oil, garlic, sugar, cumin, salt, cinnamon, and carrots in a shallow baking pan. Roast 20 minutes or until fork-tender. Remove from oven and add the raisins, lemon juice, and parsley. Toss well.

In a small bowl, combine all ingredients. Seal and place in the freezer until frozen solid. Take out of freezer and let thaw. Drink when it has thawed and is slushy. Or put in blender and blend until slushy. Garnish with fresh cranberries, zest of a lime or an orange slice.

Whilst broccoli is still hot from blanching, heat the butter and extra virgin olive oil in a pan until a light brown colour. Add roasted almond flakes and toss. Place blanched broccoli in pan. Pour over with juice of the lemon, and use seasonings to taste. Serve.

Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. While the spaghetti is cooking, heat a large saut pan over medium heat with olive oil. Saut green peppers. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add fresh tomatoes and cook until heated through. Stir in basil, crushed red pepper, black pepper and salt. Serve sauce over cooked spaghetti or other italian pasta and top with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, flour. Add to the creamed mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven about 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine turkey meat, chilies, onion, and soup. If desired, spread tortillas with butter. Cut each tortilla in half and arrange 6 halves over bottom of a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Spread a third of the turkey mixture over tortillas, top with a third of the cheese. Reapeat layers of tortillas, turkey, and cheese two more times. Carefully pour the chicken broth over all. Cover and bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated throughout and bubbly. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Cut in squares with sharp knife and use a spatula to remove each serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place the cooked chicken in a baking dish and drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Sprinkle on a pinch of salt. Roast for 25 minutes or until soft. Set aside to cool. Divide lettuce, tomato halves and radish slices between two chilled plates. Top each with half of the cooled kumara. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12-cup muffin pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine spaghetti, eggs, parmesan cheese, and pepper. Evenly press mixture into muffin cups to form a crust. Evenly top each cup with pasta sauce, then mozzarella cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a wok or skillet, heat oon sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion, chopped garlic cloves and a peeled and minced ginger. Stir-fry for a minute or so until the onion begins to turn translucent. Add the kangkong, finely chopped
Drain and reserve liquid from fruit. Add enough water to make two cups of liquid. Pour pudding mix & liquid into a pan. Cook until thickened, stir in dry jello. Mix in pineapple and oranges. Chill.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla, mixing well. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Drop by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 11-14 minutes or until light golden. Transfer cookies to wire rack to cool.

In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until smooth. Add in the sugar. Beat on low for 2 minutes. Add in the milk, syrup, and vanilla. Beat 3-5 minutes until smooth and creamy. Use immediately or store, covered, at room temperature for up to 2 days. Reportedly, the icing tastes better if made the day before because the brown sugar gives the icing a slightly grainy texture that improves if allowed to set overnight.

Preheat oven to 450. Grease or spray a large cookie sheet. Stir together dry ingredients including the sugar. Cut butter into flour mixture. Add raisins, stir to mix well. Beat egg in measuring cup. Add milk to make 1 cup. Stir into flour. Drop roughly tablespoon size scoops on cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla, mix well. Gradually beat in the flour mixture then add chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Let cookies rest on baking sheets for 2 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place crust on an ungreased 14 in pizza pan. In a small bowl, combine cheese, mayonnaise, onion, garlic, oregano, salt and pepper. Spread over crust. Bake at 450 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cut into wedges and serve warm or slightly cooled.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add cabbage, zucchini, onion, garlic cloves, butter, salt, pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes or until just barely tender. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in fresh herbs. Serve immediately.
Cook sausage until done. Add pineapple and brown sugar. Heat through. Add banana. Toss to coat and serve.

Heat oven to 400 degrees and line a baking tray with baking paper. Mix the breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, five-spice and a little seasoning on a plate. Arrange on the baking tray, then bake for 25 to 30 minutes until crips and cooked through. Mix the soy sauce with the citrus juices and sogar to make a dipping sauce. Serve the chicken with little dishes of the sauce for dipping, plus lime wedges for squeezing over.

Heat oil in an 8-to 10inch frying pan over low heat. Dip the tortillas, one at a time, in the hot oil just until limp, about 5 seconds. Fill tortillas equally with chicken mixture, roll up, and arrange side by side, slit side down, in a 9-x13 inch baking dish. Pour salsa evenly over top. Bake in a 350 degree oven until heated through, about 20 minutes. If desired sprinkle with more shredded cheese over hot enchiladas before serving.

In a large saucepan combine the chocolate, cream, butter and butter and heat over moderate heat, stirring, until chocolate is completely melted. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and a pinch of salt. Transfer to a bowl and chill for 4 hours, or until firm. Form mixture by heaping teaspoons into balls and roll lightly in peanuts. Chill on a baking sheet lined with wax paper for 1 hour, or until firm. Keep in an airtight container, chilled, for up to 2 weeks.

Heat oil in a saucepan. Add chicken and chilli mixture and cook on a low slow heat until the chicken is transparent. Add chillies to the chicken mixture and cook until the chillies are soft. Next, to the mixture in the saucepan, add the tamarind paste, fish sauce and the sugar. Simmer for ten minutes then turn off heat. Cool for a few minutes and then pour the mixture into a blender or food processor and blend until the mixture is the consistency of jam. Pour into sterilised jam jar and store in fridge. The chilli jam will last for a couple of weeks in the fridge.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes, or until golden, but not brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and discard. Add the spinach and stir until coated with the oil and spices. Stir in the spinach with just the water clinging to it, cover and cook for 4-5 minutes until wilted. Remove with a slotted spoon and continue cooking, stirring gently until the liquid evaporates. Season to taste and serve.

Heat oil in a large saucepan, add onion and garlic, cook, stirring until the onion is soft. Pour the chicken stock into the saucepan with the onion and garlic and bring to the boil. Add the potatoes, boil uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in the peas, bring to the boil and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chopped potatoes are tender. Blend potato and pea mixture in batches until smooth. Serve with a swirl of cream and chopped mint.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Combine oil, rosemary, garlic cloves, salt and pepper in large bowl. Add potato slices and turn them until throughly coated with the dressing. Roast potatoes for 35-40 minutes, spooning the oil over them 2-3 times. Remove from oven and sprinkle with a pinch of salt. Roast potatoes for 35-40 minutes, spooning

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute the beef and onion for 5 to 10 minutes, or until meat is browned and onion is tender. Drain fat. Add the celery, chili, tomatoes, taco sauce and corn. Heat thoroughly, reduce heat to low and allow to simmer. Meanwhile, prepare the noodles according to package directions. When cooked, place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour the meat mixture over the noodles, stirring well. Top with the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 25 minutes, or until cheese is completely melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 11 x 17-inch pan with pam non stick cooking spray. Combine flour and baking soda in bowl and set aside. Cream butter with sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Alternately stir in raisins and flour mixture. Fold in remaining ingredients. Spread evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool and then cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together brown sugar and butter until smooth. Stir in baking soda, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt. Add eggs and stir until blended. Stir in oats, flour and raisins. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased baking sheets. Bake for 25-30 minutes or ntil light golden brown. Cool completely in pan on wire rack.

Place cauliflower on a platter, cover with water and salt lightly. Bring to a boil and cook until easily pierced with a skewer, about 20 minutes. Drain and transfer to a serving plate. Mix oil, vinegar, salt and pepper, pour over potatoes and cauliflower, breaking them up a bit as you do. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Preheat oven

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Stir together honey, butter and crumbled bacon in a small bowl until smooth and set aside. Place carrots and water into an ungreased 9-by-9-inch baking dish, cover with foil and bake 30 minutes. Remove foil and stir in butter mixture. Bake another 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place bread on pan and put into oven for approximately 6 minutes leave oven on. Remove from oven and let bread cool slightly. Then add to food processor along with spices ground until desired consistantcy. Return crumbs to oven, spreading evenly, for approximately 5-6 minutes. Or until lightly toasted. Add parmesan cheese and stir until evenly mixed.

Scrambly-fry the beef, onion, celery, garlic, and pepper in a non-stick skillet until the beef is no longer pink. Drain. Add the mushrooms, saute for 5 minutes. Dissolve the bouillon powder in the boiling water. Add to the beef mixture. Mix well. Stir in the soy sauce and rice. Simmer, covered, for 30-40 minutes or until the rice is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place salmon in 8-inch baking dish and set aside. In a small cup or bowl mix together next 3 ingredients and pour over salmon. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with salt, parsley and green onion. Bake for about 20 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.

Cover chicken with water in a large pot. Cook 1 hour and remove chicken. Meanwhile, prepare remaining ingredients, and add to pot after removing chicken, and cook for 1 hour. Meanwhile, place chicken in baking dish and roast it in a 350 f oven for 30 minutes. After roasting, let chicken cool for 10 minutes before removing meat from the carcass and adding the meat to the soup pot. Simmer until the meat is heated through, and serve.

Heat grill. In small bowl, combine pork chops with salt and pepper. Mix well. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper. When ready to grill, brush pork chops with honey mixture. Place chops on gas grill over medium heat or on charcoal grill 4 to 6 inches from medium coals. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until pork is no longer pink in center, turning once and brushing occasionally with sauce.

Preheat oven to 325. Cream sugar and eggs until light in color and add vanilla. Mix soda into sour cream. Mix sour cream into egg mixture. Sift flour and cream of tartar together and fold into wet mixture. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake at 325 for 1 hour.

Heat oven to 400 degrees f. Cover broiler pan or cookie sheet with foil and spread asparagus in one layer. Spray with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook for 12 minutes or less. Heat butter in a small skillet on low heat until lightly brown. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Pour over cooked asparagus.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs until well beaten and slightly frothy. Whisk in milk, chives and black pepper. Set aside. In a large ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil or butter over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add egg mixture to skillet and then quickly arrange remaining ingredients on top of eggs. Cook for 3 minutes on the stovetop without stirring. Transfer to oven. Bake until the top is golden brown and the frittata is set, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

In a heatproof jug, mix the jello powder with the boiling water until dissolved. Add the cold water and pineapple juice. Put back in the fridge for about an hour, until completely set but not set yet. Add the fruit, evenly scattered through the jello

Scoop the avocado out of the skin into a bowl. Coarsely mash with fork or potato masher. Add all other ingredients except the lime juice. Lightly blend - authentic guac is chunky, not pureed. Squeeze in lime juice, mix gently and taste for seasoning adjustments.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over low heat. Add the lentils, water, vegetable oil, hot red chili pepper, fresh ginger, fresh coriander, fresh spinach, salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt, fresh ground black pepper, lemon juice, zest of, kosher salt,

In a large saute pan combine the oil, garlic and herbs. Warm over low heat for about 4 minutes. Add the beans and salt and pepper to taste. Toss gently. Cook over low heat until the beans are warm and have absorbed the flavors of the olive oil, about 5 mins. Remove from the heat, add lemon juice and toss gently. Arrange beans on a platter and surround with olives. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Place meatballs in crock pot. In a medium sized bowl mix together all remaining ingredients. Microwave on high for approximately 3 minutes or until boiling. Pour over meatballs in crock pot. Cook on low for 3 hours, stirring every half hour. Cook on low for 3 hours,

Preheat oven to 200 degrees celsius heat oil in a small frying pan and stir fry leek and bok choy until just starting to wilt. Cut 4 large squares of kitchen foi. Divide veg between them, and lay 2 pieces of fish on top of each square. In small bowl, mix together fish sauce, lime juice, chilli, soy sauce, sugar, coriander. Pour over fish. Seal foil together and place on baking tray. Place tray in oven and cook 10 minutes. Let packets sit for a couple of minutes before opening to prevent steam burns. Open and scatter fish with coriander. Serve with noodles.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet, cut side up. Drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with thyme leaves. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes begin to collapse, brushing occasionally with pan juices.

Heat oven to 425. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl sift together flour and baking soda, set aside. In a large bowl, combine butter and both sugars. Beat on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Reduce speed to low, add salt, vanilla, and eggs. Beat until well mixed, about 1 minute. Add flour mixture, mix until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop heaping spoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto baking trays lined with parchment paper. Bake until golden around the edges and soft in the middle, about 8-10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450f. Pure chipotles in adobo with garlic and honey in a blender until you have a smooth glaze. Pat pork dry and sprinkle with salt and allspice, rubbing the mixture into the meat. Put pork on a foil-lined baking sheet and spread with the glaze to coat well. Roast the pork in the middle of oven until an instant-read thermometer registers 155f, about 20 minutes. Let pork stand 5 minutes on a cutting board before cutting into thin slices.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix dry ingredients and beer. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake 1 hour, remove from pan and cool at least 15 minutes before slicing.

In a large wok, heat oil with red pepper flakes over medium-high heat. Stir in green beans. Cook, stirring frequently, for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in garlic and ginger. Cook, stirring frequently, for 3 to 4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, and then stir in black bean sauce. Cover and continue cooking until green beans are tender, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

Heat oil in medium saute pan or saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and chorizo, cook about 8 minutes till browned. Add celery, garlic and thyme, cook further 5 minutes. Add lentils, stock, salt and pepper, cook 25 minutes till lentils are tender. Remove from the heat, stir through vinegar.

Preheat oven to 375. Place apples in a 2-quart square baking dish. Stir in the granulated sugar. For topping, in a medium bowl combine the oats, brown sugar, flour, oatmeal, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, butter. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the nuts. Sprinkle topping over filling. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until fruit is tender and topping is golden. Cool slightly. Serve warm with ice cream or caramel sauce.

Heat a saute pan on medium high heat. Add in garlic, butter, wine, and half and half. Cook for 10 minutes or until reduced by half. Add in the fresh basil and the clams. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Portion a half cup of linguini on each plate, top each plate with equal portions of the clam sauce. Garnish with parmesean cheese and chopped fresh parsley and enjoy.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tuna and saut until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic powder and saut until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the onion and saut until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic powder and saut until fragrant

In a large mixing bowl, combine apples, lemon juice, lemon zest, maple syrup, dates, sesame seeds, lemon balm. Beat on high speed until soft peaks form, about 4 minutes. Spoon into dessert dishes, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish with additional whipped topping if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add lemon juice and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper and

In a large skillet, heat the oil and garlic over medium heat. Add chicken to the skillet and cook for 7 - 10 minutes. Season with black pepper. Add white wine and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Remove chicken to a platter. Saute tomatoes in the skillet until tender. Place tomatoes over the chicken and cover with pan drippings.

In a resealable plastic bag, combine chicken and salad dressing. Set aside in refrigerator for 20 minutes. Remove chicken from marinade, reserving marinade. Warm oil in a medium skillet over med-high heat. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes, or until no longer pink, turning occasionally. Stir in reserved marinade and tomatoes with juice. Heat to boiling, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes, or until a thermometer in thickest portion registers 160 degrees and juices run clear.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare cake mix according to package directions, using the eggs, water, and oil. Spoon batter into 24 paper-lined muffin pan cups, filling two-thirds full. Remove 24 cherries from cherry pie filling and set aside. Spoon generous teaspoon of remaining cherry filling onto center of each cupcake. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes, then remove from pan and let cool completely. Frost cupcakes with vanilla frosting, and garnish each one with a reserved cherry.

In a large saucepan over low heat, melt margarine. Add chili powder, garlic salt, and onion powder. Stir to mix well. In a large bowl, pour margarine mixture over popped popcorn. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and toss to coat well. Bake for 30 minutes at 325 degrees. Garnish with cheddar cheese.

Mix all ingredients together with a whisk and dump them into a ziploc to save. Should be good in the pantry for 6 months. When making the fudge frosting, preheat oven to 350f. Add milk chocolate chips, butter and corn syrup. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Remove from heat and add vanilla, peanut butter and powdered sugar. Mix well. Stir in cereal and pecans and mix ell. Spread into greased 9x13 pan. Chill until firm.

Heat olive oil in a 4 quart saucepan on medium high heat. Add onion, carrots and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally until they are soft. Add beans, water, and seasonings. Stir and reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes or until beans are tender. Take half of soup and blend in blender until smooth. Return soup to bean mixture in pan and stir. Ladle into bowls and drizzle with olive oil before serving. Top with freshly grated parmesan cheese, if desired.

Heat oven to 350. Cook beef and onion until beef is brown, drain. Spoon into ungreased 13x9x2 inch baking dish. Stir in taco mix, dry, tomato sauce and corn. Sprinkle with cheese. Stir remaining ingredients until blended, pour over beef mixture. Bake 35 minute or until light golden brown. Serve with sour cream, chopped tomato and shredded cheese, if desired.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saut onion 5 minutes, or until softened. Stir in tomatoes and basil and saut 5 minutes. Add zucchini and saut 5 minutes, or until zucchini is tender. Stir vegetables into egg mixture. Pour into a buttered shallow baking dish and bake 15 minutes or until casserole is set. Do not overcook. Cut into wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line 2 large baking sheets with silicone baking sheets or parchment paper. In a food processor, chop the parmesan, gruyere and rosemary together until coarsely chopped. Set the cheese mixture aside. Separate the dough strips. Using a pizza cutter or a large sharp knife, cut each dough strip in half lengthwise to form thin strips. Working with dough strip at a time, coat each strip with the olive oil and then the cheese mixture, pressing very gently. Twist each cheese covered dough strip and place onto prepared baking sheets. Sprinkle with the salt, if you wish. Bake until the breadsticks are golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer the warm breadsticks to a basket and serve.

In a large pot of boiling water, combine dressing ingredients, whisking until smooth. In a large pot of boiling water cook noodles according to package directions, with a slotted spoon transfer noodles to a colander and drain. Rinse under cold running water. Drain well. Transfer to a large bowl. Return cooking water to a boil. Add shrimp and rice and cook until opaque. Rinse under cold water. Drain. Combine shrimp, dressing and the remaining ingredients with the noodles. Toss to combine. This can be made ahead and refrigerated for up to 2 days.

Preheat oven to 450. Whip heavy cream until stiff, then fold in gruyere cheese and 3 tablespoons of the parmesan cheese. Spread cream mixture over top of potatoes and sprinkle remaining parmesan over it. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until top is well browned. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. In 2-quart casserole dish, combine soup, milk, chives, mustard, and hot pepper sauce. Stir in macaroni and cheese. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake 25 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

In a large mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. Mix throughly with a spoon. Make sure lumps from cake mix, are broken up. Pour into a greased and floured 10-inch bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool for 20 minutes, before removing cake from pan. Delicious when served slightly warm, with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix ingredients together in a large bowl. The dough should form a ball -- not too dry, but not too sticky either. If you have mixed for a long time, and there is still a lot of flour in the bowl, add a tiny bit more water. If the dough is too wet, add more flour. Cover the ball of dough with a thin dusting of flour, so you can remove it from the bowl. Using floured hands, spread the dough onto a greased cookie sheet -- the dough should be thin enough cover the entire sheet. Bake for 25 minutes at 350. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool, and cut into 12 slices.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Place chicken breasts in ungreased baking pan, 9 x 9 x 2. Spread 1 tsp butter on each of the four chicken breasts. Sprinkle salt and paprika on the breasts. Drizzle all with the lemon juice. Bake uncovered 35- 45 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with snipped parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Chop onions and slice mushrooms. Melt margarine in skillet. Saute onions until transparent. Add mushrooms. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Allow to cool. Mix together egg, flour, non-dairy milk and wine. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour into pie crust. Form lattice strips from second crust and place on top of quiche. Bake at 400 degrees ot 10 minutes. Then bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until a knife comes out clean. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Heat a large nonstick saut pan over high heat for 2 minutes. Add the chicken, smooth side down. Pan fry for 2-3 minutes, until juices run clear. Turn the chicken over, reduce heat, and cook for 3-6 minutes, until juices run clear. Sprinkle with a little salt and thyme just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners. Stir together flour, sugar, baking soda and baking powder. In a separate bowl, combine yogurt, egg, sugar, vegetable oil, apple, carrot, whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, waterpreparation:Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Stir together flour, sugar

Preheat oven to 450f. Cut up the apples into small chunks and place them on the bottom of a lightly greased pie pan. Combine the sugar, flour, eggs and half of the vanilla into a bowl and mix well. Pour the mixture over the apples and sprinkle with remaining vanilla. Put into preheated oven for 20-30 minutes.
